style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=1;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="47" y="123" width="110" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="YP2LvssRMxXgJCmg1-2v-44" value="<p style="margin-bottom: 0px; margin-top: 12px;">Main purpose of the partitioner:</p><ul style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px;"><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Assess and estimate the workload to be executed by the step.</span></li><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Divide the workload into equal chunks.</span></li><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Create an ExecutionContext</span><span style="background-color: initial;">&nbsp;for each chunk, container of the workload.</span></li><li><span style="background-color: initial;">Assign partitions to workers.</span></li></ul><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">Example:</p><ol style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px;"><li>Select IDs from <code>PAYMENTS</code> where status<code>&nbsp;= 'NEW'</code>.</li><li>Divide the resulting list of IDs into smaller sub-lists.</li><li>Create named ExecutionContext&nbsp;objects and pass the individual sub-lists into each context.</li></ol>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="27.5" y="166" width="239" height="298" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-5" value="PROCESSOR" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=1;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="1106.5" y="79" width="110" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-6" value="<p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">Processor is th<span style="background-color: initial;">e central point for implementing business logic and data transformations within the batch job.</span><br></p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><span style="background-color: initial;"><br></span></p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><span style="background-color: initial;">Example:</span></p><ol style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px;"><li><span style="background-color: initial;">The processor calculates the account settlement and updates the account's balance.</span></li><li>The processed objects are "wrapped" into an outputObject and passed to the writer.</li></ol>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="1084" y="129" width="234" height="177" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-8" value="WRITER" style="text;html=1;strokeColor=none;fillColor=none;align=center;verticalAlign=middle;whiteSpace=wrap;rounded=0;shadow=1;sketch=0;shadowColor=#33FFFF;textShadow=1;fontColor=#FFFFFF;shadowOpacity=80;fontSize=17;" parent="1" vertex="1"> <mxGeometry x="1593.5" y="81" width="110" height="50" as="geometry" /> </mxCell> <mxCell id="oRdzyrepOh9OLZqqPNmL-9" value="<p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><span style="background-color: initial;">Writer persists the data and is responsible for committing the transaction. It also controls the number of items in a transaction via the </span><code style="background-color: initial;">chunkSize</code><span style="background-color: initial;"> parameter in the step configuration, reducing the I/O load on the database.</span><br></p><p style="margin-bottom: 0px;">Example:</p><ol style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;"><li>Sequentially receives chunks of data containing 2 items each.</li><li>It writes 2 new Settlement and updates 2 Account entries.</li><li>Commits the bulk transaction.</li></ol>" value="<p>Reader is responsible for supplying the processor with all necessary data for the processor. It abstracts the details of data retrieval.</p><p style="margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 0px;">Example<strong>:</strong></p><ol style="padding-left: 20px; margin-top: 0px;"><li>The reader receives a list of IDs for a given partition.</li><li>It reads from the database all related entries, such as the Payment itself, the associated User, and the User's account.</li><li>It builds an InputObject&nbsp;that holds these details and passes it to the processor.</li></ol>" style="text;html=1;whiteSpace=wrap;overflow=hidden;rounded=0;fontColor=#FFFFFF;spacing=0;" li.span: Assess and estimate the workload to be executed by the step.
Divide the workload into equal chunks.
for each chunk, container of the workload.

ol.li: Select IDs from PAYMENTS where status = 'NEW'.
Divide the resulting list of IDs into smaller sub-lists.
Create named ExecutionContext objects and pass the individual sub-lists into each context.

parameter in the step configuration, reducing the I/O load on the database.

div.p: Reader is responsible for supplying the processor with all necessary data for the processor. It abstracts the details of data retrieval.

ol.li: The reader receives a list of IDs for a given partition.
It reads from the database all related entries, such as the Payment itself, the associated User, and the User's account.
It builds an InputObject that holds these details and passes it to the processor.

@Service
@StepScope
public class PamentsPartitioner implements Partitioner {

    @Override
    public Map<String, ExecutionContext> partition(int gridSize)  {
        // read or prepare partitioned ids...
        List<List<String>> partitions = new ArrayList<>(); 
        Map<String, ExecutionContext> result = new HashMap<>();
        for(int i = 0; i < partitions.size(); i++) {
            ExecutionContext context = new ExecutionContext();
            context.put("paymentIds", partitions.get(i));
            result.put("partition_" + i, context);
            //anything else you want to embed into partition.
        }
        return result;
    }
}
